title: Home
text:
As a student at UCLA pursuing a capstone major in Statistics and Data Science, I possess a strong foundation in statistical analysis and data interpretation. I am a Data Scientist at PwC, where I applying my data analytics and business skills to real-world consulting projects. Attached is my current CV and Resumé.
Through machine learning techniques, I provide insightful recommendations to our DataResolution clients. Additionally, I have project management experience through my work with American Express and a Google-sponsored Kaggle competition.
Outside of the office, I enjoy reading, walking with my mom, and crocheting.

title: Statistics Based on Adjusted Metered Water Supply Manual (2001)
text:
Researcher


February 2024



Proficient in statistical methodologies for identifying outliers in datasets relevant to determining surcharges and connection fees based on water quality parameters such as suspended solids (SS) and chemical oxygen demand (COD).
Experienced in utilizing Dixon’s Outlier Test and Rosner’s Generalized Extreme Studentized Deviate Test for outlier identification, Shapiro-Wilk Normality Test to assess the normality of data.
Strong understanding of the importance of robust outlier detection techniques in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of statistical analyses, particularly in water quality management contexts.
